intro: Bulbocodium atticum, commonly known as the Greek bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stem and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
